text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum for you today
we're tackling the muffin today i'm
going to show you a master muffin batter
that you can use with just about any
fruit or fruit and nut mix so what i
have here
raspberry i have blueberry i have
strawberry and i have a banana nut any
fruit can be used here you just need to
know the ratios of fruit and i'm going
to show you how to do that i'm going to
start with the batter itself add a half
a stick of unsalted butter at room
temperature 3/4 of a cup of granulated
sugar and i'm going to cream this
together
until it's light and fluffy but there is
a lot of sugar to butter so this isn't
going to be super light and airy while
my butter and sugar is creaming together
I'm going to sip together my dry
ingredients so I have one in 3/4 cups of
all-purpose flour in a medium sized Bowl
and to this add 1 and 1/2 teaspoons of
baking powder baking powder pups baking
soda spreads so we really are relying on
this baking powder to give a nice dome
to our muffins and 3/4 of a teaspoon of
coarse salt so sift this together using
a wire whisk this lightens the flour and
it also evenly distributes that Lebanon
and the salt amongst all of the granules
of the flour so this looks just about
right I have one large egg and one large
egg yolk add them one at a time to the
butter and sugar mixture so that the egg
blends in or emulsifies into the butter
in an even fashion and to this add our
flavoring which is one teaspoon of
vanilla extract and now the flour
mixture and the milk now whenever you're
doing this whether it's a cake a cupcake
again same same process here you want to
make sure that you start with your dry
ingredients at about half and I'm
alternated with the wet ingredients
which I'm using 2/3 of a cup of whole
milk here
and then the rest of the flour mixture
and you just want to mix this until it
comes together just like that so this is
good to go and now I'm ready to add the
fruits I think I'm going to use
blueberry today but if you're using
blueberry or raspberry it's one and a
third cups of those berries that get
folded into the batter here now if you
had something like strawberries on hand
or peaches or plums you would need 1 cup
of chopped fruit so you don't want to
add too too much of that because that's
excess moisture whenever you cut fruit
up you're increasing the surface area
which is allowing moisture to get into
your batter now if you wanted to do
banana nut it's 1 cup of chopped bananas
and quarter of a cup of toasted chopped
nuts you can use walnuts or I have
pecans here so I'm going to use
blueberries so that's 1 and 1/3 cups so
a gentle stir so I have a standard
muffin tin here and I have them lined
with paper liners and evenly distribute
the batter amongst the wells of the pan
so I like to use an ice cream scoop for
this I feel like it really helps me to
portion out the muffins evenly so that
you end up with uniform muffins and so
now for the finishing touch now this is
a little unique but it actually makes
this wonderful if you can see this
wonderful crunchy sugary top to the
muffin it's a really great thing to do
it kind of embellishes the muffin it
gives it a little extra flavor to this
I'm going to add about 1/8 of a teaspoon
of may so I'm going to eyeball it here
into the sugar just mix it up with my
fingertips now mace is a really
interesting spice it's the outer webbing
of the Nutmeg so this is whole nutmeg
here in the inside is nutmeg that you're
probably familiar with that you use in
your pumpkin pies but the outer webbing
here is mace so it's the only spice that
actually has two spices in one there you
go some information for you there and
now what I like to do is just top each
of these muffins with a little bit of
this sugar and spice mixture it adds a
really wonderful crunch and also it
looks really
really pretty too these go into the 375
degree oven for 25 minutes you want to
rotate them halfway through make sure at
25 minutes that you use a toothpick
check to make sure that there's no
sticky or tacky batter attached to the
toothpick otherwise they need to go on
for a little bit longer until they're
cooked through so into the oven take
them out of the pan and let them cool
completely on a wire rack so there you
have it throw out all of those muffin
recipes that you have you now have a
basic muffin batter that you can use
with the four fruits in front of me or
really the possibilities are endless
enjoy
you
you
